quiz.question: Choose the word that has the same rhyme scheme as the following word: battle
The words in capital letter have the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates: I bought my WIFE a red dress

options.A: Did I buy my husband a red dress?
options.B: Did I buy my wife a red shoe?
options.C: Did he buy my wife a red dress?
options.D: Did I buy my wife a black dress?

quiz.question: This question is based on 'The Life Changer' novel. Dr. Samuel Johnson is also known as_____
Choose the word that has the same CONSONANT SOUND as the one represented by the letter(s) underlined in 'wash'

In each of the following sentences, the word that resolves the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. Choose the option that is the appropriate answer: Daddy plays TENNIS on Saturday afternoons

options.A: Does mummy play tennis on Saturday afternoons?
options.B: Does daddy play tennis on Sunday afternoons?
options.C: Does daddy play tennis on Saturday morning?
options.D: Does daddy play cricket on Saturday afternoon?

quiz.question: In this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence: If he were here, it could be more fun.

options.A: He did not show up and so the occasion lacked much fun
options.B: He was expected but did not show up to liven up the occasion
options.C: There was no fun because he was not present
options.D: He was being expected to supply more fun

quiz.question: In this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence: Though he is our elected representative, he often takes a rather jaundiced view of our problems.

options.A: He takes a rather hazy view of our problems
options.B: He takes an unfavourable position concerning our problems
options.C: He takes a rather forceful view of our problems
options.D: He takes a sickly view of our problems

quiz.question: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that has the same consonant sound(s) as the one represented by the letter(s) underlined in 'Pin'.
Choose the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The stressed words are in capital letter(s): Fluency
Choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s): Victor played the role of a haughty prince.
Choose the word or group of words that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined words: The gradual process of transition to civilian rule came to an _____ end.
Fill in the gap in the sentence below with the appropriate option: Peter and Jane love each other ...... the difficulties they face.
Choose the option that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word: I was skeptical about the story she told me.
This question is based on 'The Life Changer' novel. _________ is the euphemism used for Cheat notes.
This question is based on 'The Life Changer' novel. Why did Omar say he passed his SSCE by no means a small feat?

options.B: because he failed other subjects but passed maths and English
options.C: because he registered with one of the miracle centers
options.D: Because he passed excellently on his first attempt

quiz.question: Choose the option that has the same vowel sound as the one represented by the letter[s] underlined: naked
From the list of words in A to D, choose one that best describes the sentence: James and Henry were at daggers drawn when I knew them. This means that they

options.A: were always angry with each other

quiz.question: This question is based on 'The Life Changer' novel. Who among Salma's roommates was reserved and withdrawn yet generous to a fault?
Choose the word that has the same rhyme scheme as the word below: Day
In this question, fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided: Without our relentless campaigns, we might ...... sure of victory in the race for the National Assembly.
In this question, fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided: We are all hungry; we ...... anything to eat since morning.
In this question, fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided: To check desertification in the arid zones, ...... trees should be planted.
From the options lettered A-D, choose the option that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word: My father is parsimonious.
Pick out the option with a different rhyme:
The primary stress is indicated by writing the syllable on which it occurs in capital letters. From the words lettered A to D choose the one that has the correct stress: category
This question is based on 'The Life Changer' novel. Ummi is an Arabic word that is directly translated to mean_____

From the words lettered A to D below, choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the passage: Bisi has become an indispensable member of staff.
Choose the option that has the same vowel sound as the letter(s) underlined in 'exist'.
This question is based on 'The Life Changer' novel. In Lafayette, before a stranger is hosted or accommodated, permission must be requested and granted by_______
Choose the word that does not have the same vowel sound as the others:
Athens had _________ the Greek-states against Persians.
Darius took drastic steps to __________ the rebellious Athenians.
Their participation _________ to the Athenians.
The people of Delos did not want to __________ the conquest of Greece.
The Athenians were__________ by some soldiers who arrived at Plataea.
This question is based on 'The Life Changer' novel. Salma was looking more stunning on the last day of her exams because_______

options.A: her classmates had planned to go to the beach after the exam
options.B: her classmates had organized a mini picnic to wrap up the good work
options.D: her classmates had planned a photo shoot with some lecturers

quiz.question: This question is based on 'The Life Changer' novel. Why was it a double celebration for Ummi and members of her community when she gained admission into the university?

options.B: She had given birth to Omar before her admission to the university
options.C: Her husband agreed to marry her before she went for university registration
options.D: she was the first child to leave Lafayette to the university

quiz.question: PASSAGE IV: With the most profound respect to the members of the Senate, I do not think that it is within the competence of that ...1... body to pass a motion to ...2... the executive action of the President. What fills gap ...1...?
PASSAGE IV: What fills gap ...2... in the sentence: 'to pass a motion to ...2... the executive action of the President'?
PASSAGE IV: What fills gap ...3... in the sentence: 'The Senate is ...3... of the National Assembly'?
